text:
Thanks for starting this conversation!

Many of us (myself included) transition to tech from a totally different world so we don’t know to ask or negotiate for much outside of base salary. 

(I was over the moon just to get offered a bonus and profit sharing! I never would have thought to ask for equity too.)

elements.text:
Thanks for starting this conversation!

Many of us (myself included) transition to tech from a totally different world so we don’t know to ask or negotiate for much outside of base salary. 

(I was over the moon just to get offered a bonus and profit sharing! I never would have thought to ask for equity too.)

text:
Yes, knowledge is power.

Before I changed careers from news to tech, I spent four months doing homework. That included trying to understand compensation and equity in the startup world.

There’s lots of info available online about equity, but it takes time to find bits and pieces and to connect the dots. And none of it was produced with content people in mind, especially back when I started, eight+ years ago. That’s when triangulation made a big difference.

I took time to do homework, because I’d spent decades in another industry and didn’t wanna fly blind in a new one.

text:
hey <@U02CVNB3X1T> you're definitely not alone in facing these challenges.

Agree with <@U02AR2XSN1M> about the millions of little decisions you need to make as a freelancer. The weight of those can be heavy and totally drain you of any energy for creativity.

I also like <@U014RPS9DBK>’s suggestion of exploring a part-time role, so you have a more consistent income and still flexibility in choosing your clients.

I don't think that this has to be a "freelancer vs employee" decision either. It really comes down to how you prefer to work, what your individual goals are for your career at this point, and where are you going to be able to thrive best.

I've been thinking about taking on a more full-time gig recently, provided it's:
• with a company and team that inspires me and aligns with my values
• remote work
• allowing me to develop skills in areas that I feel I'm lacking (getting paid to learn and grow is the best!)
